thread.title: Qld budget - what we know

title: Qld budget - what we know
text:
QUEENSLAND 2015 BUDGET - WHAT WE KNOW: 
FUNDING: 
* $750 million for training and skills funding to help an extra 37,000 people each year 
* $347 million for pensioner concessions 
* $210 million over four years to improve Queensland's nursing workforce 
* $180 million to attract investment and partnerships in the technology, innovation and research sectors 
* $31.3 million over four years on domestic violence initiatives 
* $30 million netball facility for the Queensland Firebirds 
* $6.6 million to provide free parental support services 
* $2 million over two years on a pilot program to help reduce homelessness and reoffending 
* There will be a $3 billion write-down in mining royalties over four years 
POLICY: 
* Labor will reduce state debt by $4.1 billion by shifting it to the books of government-owned electricity companies 
* Treasurer Curtis Pitt has ruled out using public servants' superannuation and leave entitlements to pay down debt 
* Infrastructure assessment processes will be streamlined to make it easier for private sector proposals 
* Labor has promised not to increase taxes or charges @y7finance on Twitter, become a fan on Facebook Wind and solar a source of jobs in SA AAP 
The South Australian government says a commonwealth ban on supporting solar and wind energy scheme will make it â€¦
